[color=#FFFFE0][b]Paid Whitelisting?[/b][/color]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has posted a thread in the [color=#FFFFE0][b][url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=2]Rules, Announcements, News, and Feedback[/url][/b][/color] section asking members if they would like to have an option to white list an IP. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] included this [b]could[/b] be a VPN IP OR data center. If this came into implementation there would be a small fee of $10 for an example. Previously the data center's configuration where HacKForums is hosted wouldn't allow white listing, but the firewall is being reconfigured and [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] claims he will be able to implement this which will also increase the speed when browsing HackForums, preventing Cloudflare captchas and so forth. If you are interested in giving your feedback about this you can view the thread [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5366920][b]here[/b][/url].

[color=#FFFFE0][b]Awards Went on Sale[/b][/color]
Earlier this week [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] put certain awards on a 20% sale due to the Bitcoin's that were stolen over at Bitfinex. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] was informing members to "cut their bitcoin losses". This deal only went on for a limited time of 3 days. That thread can be viewed [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5361641&page=6][b]here[/b][/url].

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/NotableThreads/KingCin.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

No notable announcements were made this week.

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5357459][b]Beginners guide to bitcoin: everything you need to know[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2960032][color=#EFEFEF][b]#Zach[/b][/color][/url]
#Zach has created a tutorial that goes into detail about the crypto currency Bitcoin and how it works. Check it out if you're new to the crypto currency scene. Pitchfork rated 7/10.[/list]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5362694][b]You can't trick a girl into being "attracted" to you, it's non-negotiable.[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3077324][color=#00AAFF][b]Vigor[/b][/color][/url]
Want a girl to be yours? Read this thread. You can't logically convince a girl to like you. Don't believe me? Go and check out Vigor's thread about the matter. It'll be enlightening to you.[/list]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5327599][b]The Complete eWhoring Guide (full guide in thread)[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2518678][b]Pittinger[/b][/url]
Interested in eWhoring? Pittinger has created a guide that will be useful to you. Don't get too deep into it and start believing you're a girl yourself.[/list]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5368404][b][Red Lions] Linux Set-Ups Helpdesk | Web Servers | Databases | Game Servers | Other[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2192831][b]Lrrr[/b][/url]
The member Lrrr has created a Linux set-up helpdesk for people that encounter issues with the topic. If you need any help related to this, or if you want to show your support, drop by on his thread![/list]

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5366805][b]Dudes of HF - Do you listen to "girly music" ever?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1356131][color=#FFFFFF][b]Nerdi[/b][/color][/url]
Do you ever listen to music that is considered feminine, or are you constantly riding around in a BMW while playing 21 Savage and Chief Keef? Let Sirental know if you ever listen to girly music.[/list]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5361643][b]AA Events || 2016 Anime Adventures Secret Santa[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=822216][color=#EFEFEF][b]Black Hole-senpai[/b][/color][/url]
The Anime Adventures section is planning the AA Secret Santa event once again. If you've never heard of it, check it out. Feel free to enter the event if you meet the requirements. If not, sorry not sorry ≧◡≦[/list]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4747490][b]Why does no one on HF have a fashion sense?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=672755][color=#EFEFEF][b]Saint Laurent Paris[/b][/color][/url]
Someone show this guy that he doesn't have a sense of fashion and that your sense of fashion is way better. He's asking for it![/list]

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5366098][b]Award/Upgrade Giveaway[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3129680][color=#EFEFEF][b]Riyu[/b][/color][/url]
Want an award or upgrade for free? Enter Riyu's giveaway and you just might get one.[/list]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5333220][b]Ryan Reynold's Darkdash Award Giveaway![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1610871][color=#FFFFFF][b]Rʏᴀɴ Rᴇʏɴᴏʟᴅs ❤️[/b][/color][/url]
Enter Ryan's giveaway if you want the Darkdash award. May the odds be ever in your favor.[/list]

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

No Feedback Threads this week.

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4670123][b]How can we make a skype bot[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2577525][color=#efefef][b]Hash G[/b][/color][/url]
Hash G has some questions for you guys! Please be kind and help our fellow writer.[/list]

[list][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5361452][b]Celebrate #Pokemon20 with the Mythical Pokemon[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131][color=#FFFFFF][b]Ariana[/b][/color][/url]
Ariana has created a very detailed thread about Pokémon. If you like the Pokémon franchise or are just bored in general, check his thread out and discuss![/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Note from Daddy[/u][/color][/b] 
Please report any informational threads on our [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5264513]Weekly Reports[/url] thread to make it easier for journalists to do their jobs.[/list]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/303.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812]Realizm:[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]
[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] Hi there! Welcome to this weeks edition of the news. Any shout outs before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url] Hey glad to be here, and yeah I'd like to give iHydra, Slaerol, Prudent, ViewsFromThe6ix, YinYang, and anyone who plays HackerCraft

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]  To start things off — what got you started with HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url]  Well I was originally looking for a gaming community and had been getting into glitches and hacks for games. Finally I came across HackForums and the rest is history.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] On the topic of games, how is the HF minecraft server holding up these days? Making a strong comeback?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url] HackerCraft has just recently launched and we are seeing around 5-15 players on which is pretty good for being just an HF advertised server. However, advertising on other websites will be happening very soon.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]  Have any special plans for the server?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url] Well I currently have multiple plugins in development for features that haven't been seen on Faction servers before. They should be finished within a week or two. The Minecrafters group might also be making an appearance on the server as well [b]wink wink[/b].

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url]  I’ll try and get on the server sometime soon. Haven’t really played the game since early beta. What do you do outside of HF?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url] Outside of HF I am always either working with my irl company, hanging with family and friends, or playing video games. I also am paying my way through college just to have an education.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] How does HF compare to when you first signed up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url] HF was a lot different back when I first signed up. Groups were a lot cheaper, Minecraft was a huge trend, and Ub3r was much more difficult to achieve. Although a lot has changed, it's still a very fun experience for me which is why I've stuck around.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] How do you think HF will change in the near future?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url]  I think HF will only grow like it has for years. The marketplace is having some great changes and new popular forums are being added. And once groups are over this crash, they'll be back to how they used to be.

[url=http://www.hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1148878][color=#FF69B4][b]Clique:[/b][/color][/url] I’d say we covered just about everything, any final words before we finish?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1343812][color=white][b]Realizm:[/b][/color][/url]  I'd like to thank the HF News for keeping us all up to date with everything HF and even not HF related. Thanks for having me :)
[/align]
[/align]
[/spoiler]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]
posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 303

posts.message:

[align=center]We publish the HF News every week yet we have aged members who don't even know we exist! Wear any of the signatures listed below to support us and spread the word about HF News, HF Wiki, and Writers altogether.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Memo.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Hi[/color][/b]
Thanks for reading this week's news, see you next week!

[b][color=white]New HFN Support Signatures![/color][/b]
Check out the new signatures [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3077324][color=#00aaff][b]That Guy Maxim[/b][/color][/url] made for HF News. Wear one and support us!

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/ScienceNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2016-08/apa-tss072816.php][b][color=white]Tinder Tears at Your Heart[/color][/b][/url]
In the 21st century, dating is no longer as simple as it once was; with hundreds of dating sites and apps that are one click away, dating is more a marketable game than reality. One of the most popular dating apps known as, Tinder, is playing a big role in changing the definition of love, and not in a good way. A study done by the American Psychological Association links Tinder users with a negative perception of body image higher than the general populous and male users with lower self-esteem. Dr. Jessica Strübel, Ph.D., of the University of North Texas, and co-author of the research, says, "Tinder users reported having lower levels of satisfaction with their faces and bodies and having lower levels of self-worth than the men and women who did not use Tinder."

[url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/releases/2016/08/160804071223.htm][b][color=white]You Are What You Eat[/color][/b][/url]
By now, we all know what eating unhealthily can do to our body: heart attack, diabetes, poor circulation, and the list goes on. Eating carelessly can be attributed to much more than a few internal problems and now advanced aging can be added to the list. A study conducted at the University of Cambridge found that in the brains middle age men, those who are obese carry the same amount of white matter as a slender man 10 years their senior. White matter is the highway of the mind, it connects and transports information all over the brain and allows different parts of the brain to work together. Luckily enough, the deterioration of white matter only seems to take place in middle age men and leads researchers to believe that our brain is particularly vulnerable during that part of the aging process. 

[url=https://www.sciencenews.org/article/vaping%E2%80%99s-toxic-vapors-come-mainly-e-liquid-solvents?tgt=nr][b][color=white]Vaping Isn't as Safe as We Thought[/color][/b][/url]
Since the technological e-cigarette fad took off back in 2008 it's been widely regarded as a much safer alternative to the conventional product, but as time goes on, we're quickly learning it's not as safe as we thought. When smoking an e-cigarette, coils inside the device heat up to vaporize a liquid that sits on cotton wicks. As you continue to use your e-cigarette, the hotter the coils get and this new study suggests it's not for the better. The usual solvents used as the base of the e-cigarettes smoke-- propylene glycol and vegetable glycerin--emit certain toxins when heated up, however, this is nothing new and at the levels they were emitted in previous tests were so low that they weren't a cause for concern; but, in those previous tests one factor wasn't accounted for, heat. Toxic aldehydes (such as formaldehyde, acetaldehyde, and acrolein) were shown to increase at an alarming rate as the e-cigarette continued to heat up throughout its usage.
 
[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.news.com.au/sport/olympics/rio-2016-olympic-athletes-told-to-keep-your-mouth-closed-when-in-contaminated-water/news-story/45e6ae4643f4dbd4001281f669b898c1][b][color=white]Troubled Waters in Rio[/color][/b][/url]
Rio is having serious troubles with water contamination. Officials are finally recognizing there is an issue, but they have not shown a willingness to allocate funds towards proper sanitation. Since little effort is being made to clean the waters of Guanabara Bay, health experts have told the Olympic athletes to "keep their mouths closed" while in the water. The waters have been found to contain microorganisms, toxins, pathogens, and viruses. Regardless of the findings, events are still scheduled to take place in the contaminated water.

[url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/france-isis-attacks-ban-foreign-financing-mosques-as-prime-minister-warns-of-more-terror-attacks-a7161561.html][b][color=white]France Considers Ban on Foreign-Funding of Mosques[/color][/b][/url]
The French government is expecting more terrorist attacks to occur in the future. In light of these expectations, France is stepping up its effort to produce counter-extremism measures. One measure calls for the country to ban foreign-funding of Mosques. When the Prime Minister was questioned about the policy, he stated very little besides that the ban would take place for an indefinite period of time. France's state of emergency continues after the recent murder of a priest in Normandy by teenage ISIS supporters. 

[url=https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/jul/27/leading-insecticide-cuts-bee-sperm-by-almost-40-per-cent-study-shows][b][color=white]Leading Insecticide Affecting Bee Population[/color][/b][/url]
The decline of honey bees has been a concern among the scientific community in recent years. However, the mystery may have finally been solved. Scientists have discovered that a leading insecticide is cutting bee sperm by forty percent, and that a specific type of insecticide is responsible for reducing the lifespan of drones by one-third. The problem with lack of bees has been concentrated in the northern hemisphere. Some countries have issued bans on certain insecticides, but not all countries agree on what should be banned. Bees are vital for pollinating three-quarters of the world's food crops, so this study will prompt further investigation.

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/TechNews/YoungThug.png[/img][/align]

[align=left][url=http://www.cnet.com/news/apple-releases-ios-9-3-4-update-to-squash-security-bug/][b]Apple hotfixes security bug with release of iOS 9.3.4[/b][/url]
Apple scrambled to hotfix a security bug found by the Pangu team in late July.  "iOS 9.3.4 addresses the problem as one in which an 'application may be able to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges,' according to an Apple support page. This means an attacker could execute virtually any command, including one that would gain control of your iOS device."  All seems well and good, except for jailbroken users.  9.3.4 patches the jailbreak released by Pangu themselves, so jailbroken users are faced with a tough choice:  risk their device's security, or lose all the jailbroken tweaks they've made to their devices.  Shortly after this bug was exposed, Apple introduced the ever popular bug bounty system, and users can earn up to $200,000 for exposing an exploit such as the one seen in 9.3.3.

[url=http://www.technewsworld.com/story/Instagrams-Stories-Inspired-by-Snapchat-83766.html][b]Instagram introduces Snapchat-like Stories[/b][/url]
In the ever-competitive battle to stay relevant, Instagram has taken a great leap forward.  Instagram has introduced their own Story system, inspired by none other than Snapchat itself.  Many users are, of course, saying that Instagram directly copied Snapchat, but Jan Dawson of Jackdaw Research explained it in a different way.  "If you spend a day doing something, you may have a bunch of pictures you want to share, but you don't want to 'overgram.' So you only post one or two pictures and you feel sad you didn't post more,"  The questions users now face is: Will Instagram replace Snapchat, and if not, what will Snapchat introduce to compete with Instagram?

[url=http://money.cnn.com/2016/08/04/technology/internet-speed-broadband/index.html?sr=cnnmoneybin080416fastinternet][b]America hits all-time high for Internet speed[/b][/url]
"For the first time ever, average download speeds for broadband users exceeded 50 Mbps this year, according to Speedtest's latest report."  Average internet speeds across America are up 52% from last June, peaking at 54.97 Mbps.  Even upload speeds are reaching an all-time high, up 51% to an average for 18.88 Mbps.  These speeds officially reach the milestone of broadband and wireless connections being 1,000 times faster than dial-up.  Now that America has the speed, they're moving onto coverage.  "The FCC recently found that 39% of rural populations lack target levels of speed: 25 Mbps for downloads and 3 Mbps uploads.  In urban areas, that percentage drops to 10%, but the disparity 'disproportionately impacts the ability of small businesses operating in rural areas to successfully compete in the 21st century economy,' the FCC report said."  America hopes to soon achieve the national average speeds all across the country.
[/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]

[url=http://www.ehackingnews.com/2016/08/yahoo-investigates-massive-breach-of.html][b][color=white]Yahoo Investigates Breach of 200 Million Accounts[/color][/b][/url]
Yahoo is investigating a large data breach after the usernames, passwords, and birth dates of 200 million Yahoo accounts went up for sale, by a hacker that goes by the alias "Peace," for the price of three bitcoins. A Yahoo spokesperson said, "We are aware of a claim. We are committed to protecting the security of our users' information and we take any such claim very seriously. Our security team is working to determine the facts..." Motherboard, that first reported the breach, acquired a sampling of some of the data and said most of it corresponded with active Yahoo accounts.

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/08/hacking-thermostat.html][b][color=white]First Smart Thermostat Ransomware is Here[/color][/b][/url]
The latest and greatest in tech is IoT (Internet of Things.) However, they pose a whole new security vulnerability as well. Last Saturday at DEFCON in Las Vegas, security researchers Ken Munro and Andrew Tierney developed and showcased a proof-of-concept ransomware on a smart thermostat that locked it to 99 degrees, and demanded $300 in bitcoins to regain control. The hackers chose a US thermostat that has an SD card slot allowing users to load wallpapers and custom settings, but also "makes it so easy to hack."

[url=http://www.computerworld.com/article/3105006/security/pc-monitor-hack-manipulates-pixels-for-malicious-effect.html][b][color=white]PC Monitor Hack Allows Malicious Pixel Manipulation[/color][/b][/url]
This past Friday, researchers at DEFCON presented a way to manipulate pixels on a computer monitor. Ang Cui and Jatin Kataria of Red Balloon Security were curious about how Dell monitors worked, and reverse-engineered one. Using a Dell U2410, they discovered the display controller inside can be used to change and log the pixels on-screen. While the hack itself was difficult--taking free time over the course of two years--they quickly found that other brands like Samsung, HP, and Acer also were susceptible to hacks in the same manner. The problem lies in a lack of security in the firmware. The exploit requires physical access to the monitor through HDMI or USB, and afterwards the exploit can easily be used for ransomware or spying on users.

[color=transparent]      [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/pokemon-go-updated-with-these-changes/1100-6442450/][color=white]The Latest Pokemon Go News![/color][/url][/b]
Pokemon Go recently rolled out another update August 8 and it didn't seem like much was added, that is, unless you were lucky enough to be selected for the new beta. The update fixed the lack of experience for nice, great, and excellent throws as well as some other bugs. However, the biggest part of the update only was made available for a select view. There was a lot of controversy surrounding the fact that Niantic took out tracking altogether, shut down third party applications that allowed you to track Pokemon, and didn't have much to say about a solution. That might have been because they were working tirelessly on a solution that seems incredible! The newest features added to Pokemon Go can be read about [url=https://www.reddit.com/r/pokemongo/comments/4wui75/pokemon_go_update_to_the_tracker_check_out_the/]here[/url]. Despite some intense player feedback, Pokemon Go has been an incredible financial success. In its first month of release, Pokemon Go has raked in $200 million dollars of revenue from in-game microtransaction. That blew the previous record of $125 million dollars set by Clash Royale out of the water. In other news about Pokemon Go, the game is now available in 15 new countries, including Indonesia, Vietnam, and Malaysia. One place where you're probably not going to be playing Pokemon Go is in Iran, which has become the first country to ban the game. It has been a bumpy, but successful month for Pokemon Go and you should expect a lot more in the upcoming months. 

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/new-prey-gameplay-trailer-explores-a-space-station/1100-6442364/][color=white]Bethesda Teases New Prey Gameplay![/color][/url][/b]
Quakecon 2016 began today, and to kick off the conference Bethesda released the first gameplay trailer for the new Prey that was announced during this year's E3. Subsequently, any hope for a direct sequel to the original Prey released in 2006 was put to rest. The director of Prey, Raphael Colantonio, stated that there was no direct correlation between the original Prey and the recently announced one. However, he said that thematically it makes sense to entitle it Prey because the games are similar at their core. In the trailer, main character Morgan Yu narrates his exploration of a space station and the enemies you'll encounter, and we also get to see some of the monsters we'll have to face. The trailer does feel like a reimagining of the 2006 Prey and that's what Colantonio was hoping for. There isn't much "gameplay" shown in the trailer, but a lot can be inferred. For example, Morgan is shown holding a pistol which points to the idea that guns will be readily available to players. In the description of the trailer, Bethesda states, "Arkane reimagines this franchise from the ground up, with an added psychological twist. In Prey, you are the first human enhanced with alien powers aboard a desolate space station under assault. Improvise and innovate in order to survive as you search for answers." The trailer can be viewed [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fCW7kx1mCEA]here[/url]. 

[b][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/ps4-neo-being-unveiled-in-early-september-report/1100-6442436/][color=white]PS4 Neo is Coming Soon![/color][/url][/b]
After confirming its existence and little else just prior to E3 in June, Sony will officially unveil an upgraded PlayStation 4 at an event in September! The PS4 Neo will be revealed at an exclusive event held in New York on Wednesday, September 7 according to reports by Vice and Gameblog. This puts it just before the start of the Tokyo Game Show, which begins on September 15. There might be more revealed the following week at Tokyo Game Show, but there are no official reports of that being the case since no further details regarding the event or what will be announced were shared. Neo is intended to "sit alongside and complement the standard PS4" which means games will be playable on both the Neo and standard PS4. Sony said at the time it will take a "small but manageable" amount of effort for developers to get games working on both versions of the PS4. We're hoping all reports are true and we'll be seeing the Neo by the end of the year. 

[align=center]Gaming Video of the Week[sp]

[yt]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X_8MHsowcEM[/yt][/sp][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/3-301.png[/img][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v3/Spotlight.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5368547][b][color=white]Aether.[/color][/b][/url]

[url=http://www.trendhunter.com/trends/appropriate-audiences][b][color=white]Tattoo-Creating Robots[/color][/b][/url]
Tattoos have always been an iffy topic. Some jobs will require you to cover up tattoos, some won't even hire you if you have any, and some simply do not care if you have a tattoo or not. Everyday somebody gets a cool new idea. Not everyone makes their ideas into a reality though. A group or company by the name of "Appropriate Audiences" has created a robot that has recently been able to make basic tattoos. If you are looking for a quick way of getting that sleeve you wanted, you are going to have to wait till these are more advanced. The group has modified a 3D printer by adding a tattoo needle to the device.  Soon after that, the group added an industrial arm which allowed the device to move freely across the body and create the design that is imputed. Taken from Trend Hunter, "The benefits of the tattooing robot are that it has a steadier hand than humans, will be able to create the exact design without human error and would be beneficial for people who aren't comfortable with other people touching them." Are you willing to let a robot do this to you? You can check out a demo video of the device in action [url=https://vimeo.com/175491863]here[/url]/

[url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-beauty/news/ariana-grande-debuts-new-bangs-to-signature-hairstyle-pic-w430787][b][color=white]Ariana Grande Finally Changed Her Signature Hairstyle[/color][/b][/url]
That's right, we had to hit Hack Forums with some Ariana Grande information. Whether you like this donut-eating pop diva or not, Ariana Grande is popularly known for wearing her hair in a ponytail. Recently the 23 year old (yes 22 and not 12!) diva who is currently nominated for five VMA (Video Music Awards) categories added a little flare to her hair. Ari surprised the Arianator fandom by posting a selfie of herself with a new look and tweeting out "Bang Bang"! With no caption, the "Into You" artist became one of the most talked about in the celebrity world and has been trending since. If you're interested in seeing her new look, you can do so by clicking [url=https://www.instagram.com/p/BIOQkaJAf3a/]here[/url]. What triggered her to change her hair? Good question. A video which sadly cannot be found was posted throughout tumblr and Twitter showing her drunk ex (yes you heard that right fellows, Ariana Grande is now single) saying, "F**k DJ Khaled" which then led to the Major Key of Success leaving the party. Ariana found his comment to be rude, and soon later broke up with him recently. No tweet was made in regards to the couple who have been dating for almost a year now. Fans noticed that the pop diva had been removing any pictures they took together that were posted on Instagram or Facebook, and if any were left up Ari has decided to turn comments off. New look, new style, what is next to come for Ariana Grande?

[url=http://www.wsj.com/articles/rio-2016-the-national-houses-of-the-olympic-games-1470744635][b][color=white]2016 Summer Olympic Kicks Off[/color][/b][/url]
The 2016 Summer Olympics being hosted in Brazil has finally kicked off. Already top teams from all around the world have took the winners spot to earn a gold medal for their country. Special visits from celebrity guests also visit for the welcoming/opening ceremony. Some of these guests include Victoria Secret models returning home to support their home country. Ryan Seacrest was lucky enough to have lunch with two beautiful Victoria Secret angels, Alessandra Ambrosio and Adriana Lima. Their lunch selfie can be seen [url=http://i.imgur.com/fSZwSOB.jpg]here[/url]. A lot of controversy with Russia and their teams have speculated on the news saying that some of Russia's players are cheating by taking drugs. Within the Olympics are four theme houses. These themes replicate a country around the world and what's unique to them. The first house is the Swiss House, which well, obviously represents Switzerland. Anything snow related you can find here. There is even a snow globe that is 200 square-meters in size with an ice skating rink and much much more. The second house, Holland Heineken House, represents and supports The Netherlands. It can be described as a club and is located in a 100,000 square-foot sports club. That is HUGE! If you like to party, this is definitely the club house for you. The Holland Heineken House has a luxurious pool, jumbo poolside TV, and music playing all day and even at night. Make sure that you are of legal drinking age as this place really will not be fun for you otherwise! The second to last house for the Olympic Games is the Portugal's ship. It's not exactly a house, but that does not necessarily mean you cannot have fun at all. The ship traveled all the way from Lisbon, Portugal all the way to the docks of Rio. The trip took 40 days to get to Rio. What a long trip. Do you think you could make that? Last but not least, the last house event for the 2016 Summer Olympics is the Qatar’s house. It was a museum in the past and is now run by a Brazilian non-profit organization. You must pay to enter, but all payments will go towards schools and helping the children of Brazil. You can get a taste of Arabian food and check out the history of the Qatar’s market.
